basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Judith Ukachukwu. I am a backend software engineer with a knack for building robust, scalable systems that power applications smoothly. I specialize in designing and implementing server-side logic, APIs, and databases, ensuring everything runs efficiently behind the scenes. I've got some frontend skills in my toolkit, enough to craft clean and functional user interfaces when needed, but my heart lies in the backend. I've led one project as a team leader, where I coordinated tasks, aligned the teamâ€™s vision, and ensured we delivered on time. It was a great experience that taught me the value of clear communication and keeping everyone motivated. Collaboration is my jam. I love working with others, brainstorming solutions, and learning from diverse perspectives. My interpersonal skills help me connect with teammates, resolve conflicts, and foster a positive, productive environment, always excited to team up on new projects, bring my backend expertise (and a sprinkle of frontend know-how) to the table, and contribute to something awesome. Letâ€™s build something great together!

projects.title: Animal Shelter
projects.description: The most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. I've learned many technologies and my code was reviewed by awesome curator. Application handles all adoption processess and allows to store all evidence on adopting animals from animal shelter.

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
